column4: seriously, why do I have to ask how to open a 2nd xterm window? this is nauseating
Do you have a toolbar?
I have the default setup for ubuntu 11
on the left? yeah
yepper
Did you right click on the icon?  There should be a box with 4 options.  The top one is "New Terminal"  Click on that one.
thats not an option. I only have 3
OK...Go to the top icon, the one that's like a Ubunto logo.
It's Dash Home
Click on it.  I'm looking for the icon to start a terminal.
I can find xterm but not sure what to do with it
Click on "More Apps" and select All.  The all is in the upper right hand corner.
Then you're not familiar with the command-line interface (CLI)?
Believe me, you can do more with a command-line interface than the GUI :-)
oh, I am. Do you know how I can launch a term from the toolbar instead of going through the menus?
Drag and drop the xterm icon from the Dash Home to your tool bar.
...I hope this works...
You may get it after the drag and drop...I hope so.
doesnt work... oh well, not the biggest deal in the world. I can figure this out later
k
I believe you're spun around and pointed in the right direction.
thanks
